newsitem.title: USA: Union likely to pick Ford for contract talks --NYT.
newsitem.headline: Union likely to pick Ford for contract talks --NYT.

text.p: The United Auto Workers union is likely to pick Ford Motor Co for a final round of talks aimed at producing a national labour contract, The New York Times reported on Tuesday.
An announcement on which of the Big Three auto makers the union would pick could come as early as Tuesday, union officials told the newspaper.
The UAW has been in talks with General Motors Corp and Ford for a week, and unless GM improves its contract offer immediately it would pick Ford as its target, the paper said.
The union would try to use a Ford deal as a national labour contract that could be applied across the industry.
The three-year contracts with Ford, GM and Chrysler Corp all expire on September 14, and job security is said to be the major issue in this year's talks.
